Title: Cryogenic Tank Gravimetric Efficiency
Problem_Statement: Aviation LH₂ tanks require ≥6% gravimetric efficiency (fuel/total tank mass) to achieve competitive range, but current aerospace-qualified designs achieve only 3-5%
Impact_Hypothesis: HIGH: Range shortfall if not achieved; aircraft weight penalty reduces payload
Heritage_Sources: NASA X-57, Airbus ZEROe, Toyota Mirai

Title: BWB Conformal Tank Integration
Problem_Statement: Integrating LH₂ tanks into BWB structure presents novel structural and thermal challenges with no heritage for commercial aviation
Impact_Hypothesis: HIGH: Structural integrity; thermal management in distributed architecture

Title: Tank Cycling Durability
Problem_Statement: LH₂ tanks must survive 30,000+ thermal cycles (ambient to 20K) without degradation; limited test data for composite tanks at this scale
Impact_Hypothesis: MEDIUM: Tank replacement interval; maintenance costs; safety margins

Title: Boil-off Management Strategy
Problem_Statement: Ground operations require minimal boil-off (<0.5%/day) to avoid fuel loss and safety concerns; active vs passive strategies unresolved
Impact_Hypothesis: MEDIUM: Operational costs; ground handling complexity; fuel efficiency
Heritage_Sources: Space: active cooling; Automotive: passive (short duration)

Title: MLI Performance in Flight
Problem_Statement: Multi-Layer Insulation performance under flight vibration and pressure differential conditions is not well characterized
Impact_Hypothesis: MEDIUM: Thermal performance degradation; boil-off increase over time
Heritage_Sources: Space: vacuum environment; limited aircraft data

Title: Hydrogen Embrittlement Risk
Problem_Statement: Long-term hydrogen exposure effects on tank materials and fittings need characterization for aircraft duty cycles
Impact_Hypothesis: HIGH: Safety-critical; structural integrity over service life
